line_1: If, as the wisest of the Wise, have err'd,
line_2: I go astray, and am condemn'd unheard;

line_1: While Talbot tells the World, where Montaigne err'd.
line_2: Nor longer hence the Gallic Style preferr'd,

line_1: While Talbot tells the World, where Montaigne err'd.
line_2: Wisdom in English Idiom shall be heard;

line_1: Thro' toils and death had madly err'd;
line_2: She sung, that names thro' time rever'd,

line_1: By you neglected I have err'd,
line_2: Prostrate she says — hail mighty Lord!

line_1: Thou thro' good nature may'st have err'd,
line_2: And therefore shall thy pray'r be heard;
